alert.note: Alert for West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA AND NORTHEASTERN MCKINLEY COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Crownpoint to McCartys. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grants, Milan, Crownpoint, Cubero, Cebolletita, McCartys, Prewitt, Skyline-Ganipa, San Fidel and San Mateo. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 60 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
